Sentencas: Stationary applications of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell systems require operating times of 40,000 to 80,000 h for market introduction.
Titulo: Long-term operation of solid oxide fuel cells and preliminary findings on accelerated testing

Sentencas: Therefore, extended lifetime tests are essential for learning about the long-term behavior and various degradation mechanisms and to foster ideas about accelerated stack testing.
Titulo: Long-term operation of solid oxide fuel cells and preliminary findings on accelerated testing

Sentencas: The Forschungszentrum Julich has been gradually extending the testing time, resulting in successful short-stack operating times of between 20,000 and 40,000 h. This work highlights the results of these long-term tests and compares the observations for different material combinations, operating temperatures of 700 and 800 degrees C, including different fuel utilizations and gas compositions.
Titulo: Long-term operation of solid oxide fuel cells and preliminary findings on accelerated testing

Sentencas: An increase of temperature from 700 to 800 degrees C leads to an acceleration of the degradation rate by a factor of 1.5-2.
Titulo: Long-term operation of solid oxide fuel cells and preliminary findings on accelerated testing

Sentencas: Meanwhile, an increase in fuel utilization from 40 to 80% did not result in increased degradation.
Titulo: Long-term operation of solid oxide fuel cells and preliminary findings on accelerated testing

Sentencas: The same was found for higher current densities of up to 1 Acm(-2).
Titulo: Long-term operation of solid oxide fuel cells and preliminary findings on accelerated testing
